thread.title: Former U.N. General Assembly President Charged in Bribery Scheme
thread.title_full: Former U.N. General Assembly President Charged in Bribery Scheme - WSJ

author: Rebecca Davis O’Brien
title: Former U.N. General Assembly President Charged in Bribery Scheme
text:
A former president of the United Nations General Assembly was arrested and charged Tuesday in a wide-ranging bribery scheme involving payments by Chinese business interests to U.N. officials to gain support for real-estate development in Macau, federal officials said Tuesday.
Authorities allege that John Ashe, a former ambassador to the U.N. for Antigua and Barbuda who led the U.N.’s 68th General Assembly in 2013, accepted more than $1 million in bribes in various forms from Chinese businesspeople in exchange for...
